thread.title: Amy Rodriguez Propels FC Kansas City to NWSL Championship
thread.title_full: Amy Rodriguez Propels FC Kansas City to NWSL Championship

title: Amy Rodriguez Propels FC Kansas City to NWSL Championship
text:
Get Sports Alerts 
5 Oct 2015 07:08 AM EST 
Amy Rodriguez scored off a header in the 78th minute and FC Kansas City sent midfielder Lauren Holiday into retirement with a 1-0 victory over the Seattle Reign for the National Women’s Soccer League championship game Thursday night. Rodriguez scored off a cross from Heather O’Reilly. Just moments later there was a scary moment when Holiday went down and a stretcher was brought on to the field. Holiday walked to the sideline on her own and eventually returned for the final minutes of her last competitive game. Holiday announced plans to step away from the game in July, shortly after winning the Fifa Women’s World Cup with the US national team, but she vowed to first finish out the season with her NWSL club.
